channel.title: noobs trying to steal steam accounts
channel.description: Okay for the last week now I have been getting spam mail saying my steam account needs to be verified.When I check my steam account it appears to be verified also. My Firefox browser addon wot underlines the link as untrusted, is there anyway to keep noobs from sending me these emails? :brow: Edit: I just cheeked the link, with another computer, and the link is blocked by Firefox by default.

item.title: noobs trying to steal steam accounts
item.dc:creator: coldroll
item.description:
I didn’t get a chance to report him, but I did report the link as a web forgery to Mozilla Firefox. Sadly though I deleted the message. Also the user is a fail troll.

Read full topic
item.source: noobs trying to steal steam accounts

item.title: noobs trying to steal steam accounts
item.dc:creator: bigfan421
item.description:
I think coldroll is talking about his EMAIL not his Private messages. My advice is this, Ignore It. Oh and you probably were asked by a specific user to be the admin of his servers no? you wanna report this user.
I’m saying this from EXPERIENCE.

Read full topic
item.source: noobs trying to steal steam accounts

item.title: noobs trying to steal steam accounts

item.description:
OH SHIT WHAT DO I DO I HAVE VIRUSES

I lol’d at how it included some random member names, and how the space in “Pokemon Eater” broke the link…

item.title: noobs trying to steal steam accounts
item.dc:creator: Acristoff
item.description:
Delete your win32 files. ALT + F4. Pour Himalaya dew all over your computar. Try turning it off and on again. Check if the cable is connected. Is the light blinking?

Read full topic
